full_summary:
===============

**Avian GPS Tags Tender Announcement**
=====================================

**Reference Number**: WS3732533945
**Publication Date**: November 24, 2022
**Tender Closing Date**: December 16, 2022 (14:00:00)

Background
----------

The Department of the Environment (ECCC) is looking to establish a Standing Offer (SO) for the provision of Avian GPS Tags. The SO period will be two years, with two irrevocable options to extend for one-year periods.

**Supply Requirements**
----------------------

The successful Vendor(s) will be required to provide various GPS bird tagging devices on an “as and when requested” basis.

**Key Specifications**
----------------------

The Avian GPS Tags must meet the following specifications:

* Radio Frequency Identification Devices (RFID)
* Global Positioning System (GPS) Antennas
* GPS Receivers

**Trade Agreements**
-------------------

Canada welcomes bids from suppliers who have the necessary certifications for the following trade agreements:

* Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
* Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)
* World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)
* Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA)
* Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)

**Regions**
----------

This tender is open only to bidders located in Canada.

**Contracting Entity**
----------------------

This tender is being issued by the Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) on behalf of ECCC.

**Contact Information**
----------------------

For more information, please contact Thomas Leboeuf at:
thomas.leboeuf@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

**Notice URL**
-------------

To download the full tender package, please visit: http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/14729169?extsite=MTQ3MjkxNjlfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==

Note: The original information has been reformatted and rewritten to provide a clearer and more concise overview of the tender announcement. Please note that this rewritten text does not include all the original details, but it highlights the essential information. If further information is required, please refer to the original tender document. 

* Removed the date and time markers used in the original text. 
* Changed the title to a more descriptive name, and possibly rearranged the general organization of the markdown titles, as per Markdown style recommendations.
